summary: This bill, the "Snap Back Inaccurate SNAP Payments Act," aims to amend the Food and Nutrition Act of 2008 to improve the calculation and reduce the taxpayer cost of payment errors within the Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program (SNAP). It focuses on adjusting the quality control system tolerance levels for excluding small errors, modifying how state agencies are held liable for payment errors based on recouped overpayments, and mandating state agencies to recoup overpayments. The bill's intent is to improve program efficiency and financial accountability in SNAP.
